metadata.title: Balwant Seva Sansthan - Empowering Rural Communities
metadata.description: Balwant Seva Sansthan is a charitable foundation dedicated to uplifting rural communities in Haryana through education, healthcare, and sustainable development.

hero.title: Empowering Rural Lives Through Compassion and Service
hero.subtitle: Balwant Seva Sansthan works at the grassroots level to bring education, healthcare, and opportunity to underserved villages across Haryana.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Founded in the memory of late Shri Balwant Singh and late Smt. Sunehari Devi, our sansthan is committed to serving rural communities by providing access to quality education, free healthcare, agricultural guidance, and awareness of government welfare schemes. We believe that every villager deserves the opportunity to lead a dignified and self-sufficient life.

programs.title: Our Programs
programs.subtitle: From healthcare and education to agricultural awareness and government scheme outreach, our programs are designed to address the real needs of rural families.

about.title: About Balwant Seva Sansthan
about.subtitle: A legacy of service rooted in love, compassion, and the unwavering belief that rural communities deserve better.

story.title: Our Story
story.p1: Balwant Seva Sansthan was established in the village Khairi, Hisar on 31st of December 2025 in loving memory of late Shri Balwant Singh, a man who spent his life serving the people of his village Khairi and left the world too soon. Him and his wife, Late Smt. Sunehari Devi believed that true wealth lies not in what we accumulate but in what we give back to our community. They both were known to be always open to those in need, and never turned away anyone seeking help, whether it was a meal, guidance, or simply a kind word.
story.p2: Inspired by their selfless spirit, their son Saty Narain Kundu founded this sansthan to carry forward their vision of a just and empowered rural society. A Civil Engineer by education who retired from the Haryana Government HSAMB Department as Sub Divisional Engineer, he has always believed in giving back and supporting the community. He maintains that one must never stray from their roots and should stay humble while keeping strong engagement with society.
story.p3: Today, Balwant Seva Sansthan runs free medical camps, supports children's education, manages the Sunehari Devi Library for girls, and conducts awareness drives about government welfare schemes and modern agricultural practices. Every program we run is a tribute to the belief that even one person's dedication can transform an entire community.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: A rural India where every individual has access to quality education, healthcare, and the knowledge to claim their rights and build a self-reliant future. We envision thriving villages where children dream boldly, women lead confidently, and farmers prosper sustainably.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To empower underserved rural communities in Haryana by delivering free healthcare, promoting education for children and girls, spreading awareness of government welfare schemes, and fostering agricultural and entrepreneurial knowledge at the grassroots level.

items.title: Compassion
items.description: We approach every individual and family with empathy and genuine care, understanding their struggles and treating them with the dignity they deserve.

items.title: Education
items.description: We believe that education is the most powerful tool for transformation. Every child, regardless of their background, deserves the chance to learn and grow.

items.title: Empowerment
items.description: We do not just provide aid; we equip communities with knowledge, skills, and awareness so they can stand on their own and advocate for their rights.

items.title: Sustainability
items.description: Our programs are designed for lasting impact. We focus on building local capacity and sustainable practices that continue to benefit communities long after our direct involvement.

items.title: Integrity
items.description: We operate with complete transparency and accountability. Every rupee donated is used responsibly, and we maintain honest communication with our supporters and beneficiaries.

items.title: Community
items.description: We believe that meaningful change happens when people come together. Our work is built on collaboration with villagers, local leaders, volunteers, and partner organizations.

team.title: Our Team
team.subtitle: A dedicated group of individuals driven by the shared goal of rural upliftment and community service.

members.name: Saty Narain Kundu
members.description: Son of late Shri Balwant Singh and late Smt. Sunehari Devi. A Civil Engineer by education, retired from Haryana Government HSAMB Department as Sub Divisional Engineer. Founded the sansthan to honour his parents' legacy of community service.

library.title: Sunehari Devi Girls Library
library.subtitle: A sanctuary of knowledge and empowerment for the girls of rural Haryana.
library.description: Named in the cherished memory of our mother, late Smt. Sunehari Devi, this library stands as a tribute to her lifelong belief in the power of education for girls. Sunehari Devi herself never had the opportunity to attend school, yet she ensured that every girl in her family received an education. Inspired by her quiet determination, we established this library to provide a safe, welcoming space where girls from surrounding villages can read, study, prepare for examinations, and discover the confidence to shape their own futures.

items.title: Reading Programs
items.description: Structured reading sessions for children and young adults, including storytelling hours, book clubs, and guided reading activities to cultivate a lifelong love of learning.

items.title: Digital Resources
items.description: Access to computers and tablets loaded with educational software, online courses, and digital study materials to bridge the rural-urban knowledge gap.

items.title: Exam Preparation
items.description: Dedicated study sections and coaching support for girls preparing for board examinations, competitive exams, and college entrance tests, with curated reference materials.

items.title: Safe Space for Girls
items.description: A secure and supportive environment where girls can study without hesitation, attend workshops on health and career awareness, and build friendships with fellow learners.

items.title: Mentorship Program
items.description: Connecting young girls with educated women from nearby towns and cities who volunteer as mentors, providing academic guidance, career counseling, and personal encouragement.

items.title: Community Events
items.description: Regular cultural events, essay competitions, debate sessions, and awareness drives organized at the library to engage the wider village community and celebrate learning.

programs.title: Our Programs
programs.subtitle: Comprehensive grassroots initiatives addressing the most pressing needs of rural communities across health, education, agriculture, and government welfare awareness.

medical.title: Medical Health Camps
medical.description: We organize free medical health camps in underserved villages where access to even basic healthcare is a challenge. Our camps bring qualified doctors, nurses, and health workers directly to the community, providing general checkups, screenings, and distribution of essential medicines at no cost.
highlights: Free general health checkups and consultations
Blood pressure, diabetes, and vision screenings
Distribution of free medicines and first-aid kits
Maternal and child health awareness sessions

education.title: Educational Initiatives
education.description: Education is at the heart of everything we do. Our educational programs support children from economically weaker families by providing free tutoring, school supplies, and scholarship assistance. We run after-school learning centers where trained volunteers help students.
highlights: Free after-school tutoring and homework support
Distribution of textbooks, notebooks, and stationery
Scholarship assistance for meritorious students from low-income families
Board exam preparation workshops and study groups

agriculture.title: Agricultural & Rural Business Awareness
agriculture.description: Most families in our target villages depend on agriculture for their livelihood, yet many lack access to modern farming knowledge and market information. Our agricultural awareness program organizes workshops on improved cultivation techniques, organic farming, and efficient use of water resources.
highlights: Workshops on modern and organic farming techniques
Soil testing awareness and crop rotation guidance
Water conservation and efficient irrigation practices
Rural entrepreneurship and small business development training

government.title: Government Scheme Awareness
government.description: A significant number of rural families remain unaware of the government welfare schemes they are entitled to benefit from. Our awareness camps educate villagers about key central and state government programs and assist them with the application process.
highlights: PM-KISAN: Helping eligible farmers enroll for direct income support of Rs. 6,000 per year
Ayushman Bharat (PMJAY): Assisting families in obtaining health insurance coverage of up to Rs. 5 lakh
MGNREGA: Guiding rural households on securing 100 days of guaranteed wage employment
Kisan Credit Card: Supporting farmers in applying for affordable agricultural credit

getInvolved.title: Get Involved
getInvolved.subtitle: Every contribution, whether of time, resources, or voice, brings us closer to transforming the lives of rural families. Here is how you can help.

donate.title: Donate
donate.description: Your financial contribution directly funds free medical camps, educational materials for children, library resources, and awareness programs. Every rupee you donate reaches the people who need it most, with complete transparency and accountability.

volunteer.title: Volunteer
volunteer.description: Join our team of dedicated volunteers who travel to villages, teach at learning centers, assist at health camps, and help families navigate government schemes. Whether you can give a few hours or a few months, your time and skills can change lives.

spread.title: Spread the Word
spread.description: Share our story with your friends, family, and social networks. Raising awareness about our work helps us reach more supporters, attract partnerships, and amplify our impact across more villages.

posts.title: Medical Camp in Sarai Village Provides Free Checkups to Over 300 Families
posts.excerpt: Our most recent medical health camp in Gram Panchayat Sarai brought together a team of five doctors and twelve health workers who provided free general checkups, diabetes screenings, and eye examinations to over 300 families. Essential medicines were distributed, and 45 patients were referred to the district hospital for further treatment.

posts.title: Sunehari Devi Girls Library Expands Collection with 500 New Books
posts.excerpt: Thanks to generous donations from supporters across the country, our girls' library has added 500 new books covering science, literature, competitive exam preparation, and career guidance. The expanded collection is already seeing increased daily visits from girls in surrounding villages eager to explore the new resources.

posts.title: Agricultural Workshop Introduces Organic Farming Practices to Local Farmers
posts.excerpt: Over 80 farmers from twelve villages attended our two-day agricultural workshop focused on organic farming methods, soil health management, and water conservation techniques. Expert speakers from the Krishi Vigyan Kendra guided participants through practical demonstrations, and each farmer received a starter kit for organic composting.
